TITLE: Brazil president Jair Bolsonaro hospitalized after abdominal discomfort
SUMMARY: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro was taken to a Sao Paulo hospital for tests early Monday after experiencing abdominal discomfort, the government said.

TITLE: 2 armed drones intercepted as they approached Iraqi base hosting US troops: report
SUMMARY: Two drones were intercepted Monday as they neared an Iraqi base that had been housing American forces on the anniversary of the U.S. assassination of a top Iranian commander, a report said.

TITLE: Aoife Beary, a survivor of 2015 Berkeley balcony collapse, dead at 27: report
SUMMARY: A woman who was one of the survivors in the fifth-floor balcony collapse in 2015 that killed six college students in Berkeley, California, died Saturday night after suffering a stroke earlier in the week, according to a report.

TITLE: Jerusalem Post hacked on anniversary of Soleimani drone strike
SUMMARY: The Jerusalem Post said Monday that its website and Twitter account were targeted by “pro-Iranian hackers” who posted an ominous image of a model of the Israeli Dimona nuclear facility under a ballistic missile attack.

TITLE: Sudan’s PM announces resignation amid political deadlock
SUMMARY: Sudan’s Prime Minister Abdalla Hamdok announced his resignation Sunday amid political deadlock and widespread pro-democracy protests following a military coup that derailed the country’s transition to democratic rule.

TITLE: Thousands protest strict lockdown measures in Amsterdam despite local government ban
SUMMARY: Thousands of protesters in the marched in the streets of Amsterdam on Sunday to protest the government's coronavirus prevention measures, ignoring a ban placed on the demonstrations.

TITLE: Devastating fire rips through South Africa’s Parliament complex
SUMMARY: A major fire ripped through South Africa's Parliament complex on Sunday, gutting offices and causing some ceilings in the building that houses the national legislature to collapse.

TITLE: Kim Jong Un largely ignores US, South Korea in year-end speech, vows weapons development
SUMMARY: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un vowed to pursue high-tech weapons to counter what he called military instability on the Korean Peninsula, but largely ignored the U.S. and South Korea in a year-end speech.

TITLE: Scotland moves to pardon thousands executed as witches -- 400 years later
SUMMARY: Legislation is moving through Scotland’s parliament to pardon thousands of women who were snared in Scotland’s great purge, including some who were tortured to death in the North Berwick witch trials.

TITLE: Baghdad rally marks anniversary of Iranian general's death; US, Israeli flags trampled
SUMMARY: Chanting anti-American slogans, hundreds of people rallied in the Iraqi capital Saturday to mark the anniversary of the killing of a powerful Iranian general and a top Iraqi militia leader in a U.S. drone strike.

TITLE: Pope Francis honors mothers, says violence against women is 'almost Satanic'
SUMMARY: Pope Francis began the new year with a sermon on the Virgin Mary, saying that to hurt a woman is a direct insult to God and decrying the harm done to women around the world.

TITLE: COVID-19: Goats and sheep encourage vaccination in Germany
SUMMARY: Goats and sheep did their part in encouraging Germans to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.

TITLE: Boris Johnson warns COVID-19 has put UK's health system under strain
SUMMARY: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson warned that the country's health system is under a strain due to the increase in COVID-19 infections.

TITLE: British government rushes COVID-19 tests to schools before kids return
SUMMARY: Schoolchildren returned to classes Monday in parts of Europe, while the British government pledged to rush ventilation units and enough COVID-19 test kits to schools to ensure they, too, can reopen later this week despite soaring infection rates in the UK.

TITLE: Ontario begins lockdown: schools, gyms, indoor dining closed again
SUMMARY: All schools in Canada’s most populous province will be shut down and move to online learning because of a record number of coronavirus infections fueled by the ultra-contagious omicron variant, Ontario’s premier announced Monday.

TITLE: Evangelicals increase in Spain
SUMMARY: The number of evangelicals in Spain has been on the rise in recent years.

TITLE: China pledges to continue to 'modernize' nuclear arsenal, calls on US, Russia to make greater cuts
SUMMARY: China on Tuesday said it would keep modernizing its nuclear program in the name of "safety" but called on the United States and Russia to make greater cuts to their arsenal stockpiles.

TITLE: China COVID lockdown causes some food shortages
SUMMARY: Residents of the Chinese city of Xi'an are enduring a strict coronavirus lockdown, and some people complaining of difficulties finding food,

TITLE: England sees no need for further restrictions - for now
SUMMARY: U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson said Tuesday he hoped to “ride out" the pandemic without further restrictions

TITLE: North Korea launches suspected ballistic missile for first time in two months
SUMMARY: North Korea launched a suspected ballistic missile into its eastern waters on Wednesday, just one week after Kim Jong Un pledged to ramp up the country's military might.

TITLE: Kazakhstan’s president declares state of emergency as protests over fuel price jump turns violent
SUMMARY: Violent protests broke out in Kazakhstan’s most populated city on Wednesday over fuel prices that resulted in President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev declaring a state of emergency as government buildings were attacked across Almaty.

TITLE: French president Macron's desire to 'piss off' unvaccinated individuals triggers outrage
SUMMARY: Macron's comments come just a few months ahead of a presidential election, providing his opponents a strong platform from which to attack him.

TITLE: FBI arrests main suspect in Haiti president assassination
SUMMARY: U.S. authorities have taken into custody a suspect in the assassination of the Haitian president. Mario Antonio Palacios is a Colombian national who fled to Jamaica and had evaded arrest for months.

TITLE: COVID rule-resisting Canadian pastor criminally charged after attending protest outside health minister's home
SUMMARY: The Polish-Canadian pastor who has been repeatedly arrested for holding church gatherings in Calgary, Alberta, was arrested again over the weekend after he attended a protest outside the provincial health minister's home.

TITLE: Google now under extra antitrust scrutiny in Germany
SUMMARY: Google was put under greater scrutiny by a German watchdog group.

TITLE: COVID-19 omicron variant sets record for new infections in Israel
SUMMARY: The COVID-19 omicron variant has been setting a record for infections in Israel.

TITLE: Pope criticizes couples who adopt pets instead of children: 'a form of selfishness'
SUMMARY: The pope believes that people need to focus on having children in order to combat the decline in birth rates in the West.

TITLE: Kazakhstan president's home ablaze as protests escalate: report
SUMMARY: Protesters in Kazakhstan's largest city stormed the presidential residence and the mayor's office on Wednesday and set both buildings on fire, according to new reports, as demonstrations sparked by a rise in fuel prices in the Central Asian nation escalated sharply.

TITLE: France allows COVID infected medics to work
SUMMARY: France is allowing health care workers who are infected with the coronavirus but have few or no symptoms to keep treating patients rather than self-isolate

TITLE: 20,000 Afghan commandos left behind, lawmakers and veterans urge Biden to rescue them
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has pledged to help vulnerable Afghans escape, but some lawmakers and veterans say the government has no plans to rescue Afghan commandos

TITLE: Hong Kong bans flights, imposes other COVID-19 restrictions
SUMMARY: Hong Kong authorities announced a two-week ban on flights from the United States and seven other countries and held 2,500 passengers on a cruise ship for coronavirus testing Wednesday as the city attempted to stem an emerging omicron outbreak.

TITLE: China fires hospital workers when woman miscarries after denied entry to facility: report
SUMMARY: The Chinese government fired two hospital workers and suspended another this week after a woman who was eight months pregnant miscarried outside of a hospital when she was denied entry on Jan. 1 because of strict coronavirus protocols, according to reports.

TITLE: Piranha attacks in Paraguay leave 4 dead, more than 20 injured this year
SUMMARY: Four people were killed and 20 others have been injured in separate piranha attacks in Paraguay this year, causing concern among locals.

TITLE: Kazakhstan unrest leaves dozens dead, police say
SUMMARY: Police in Kazakhstan’s largest city said Thursday that 12 officers have been killed in clashes with protesters. One of the police officers was found beheaded.

TITLE: Pope Francis encourages a 'courageous and prophetic faith,' decries consumerism
SUMMARY: Pope Francis marked Epiphany on Thursday by encouraging people to shake off consumeristic “tyranny” and crises of faith in lives and societies and instead find the courage to work for justice and brotherhood in societies dominated by what he called the “sinister logic of power.”

TITLE: What's behind unrest rocking oil-rich Kazakhstan
SUMMARY: Kazakhstan is experiencing the worst street protests the country has seen since gaining independence three decades ago.

TITLE: North Korea announces second hypersonic missile test was successful
SUMMARY: North Korea claimed Thursday to have conducted the second successful test flight of a hypersonic missile, days after leader Kim Jong Un vowed to bolster his military forces despite pandemic-related difficulties.

TITLE: COVID-19: Japan asks US military to stay on base amid pandemic
SUMMARY: Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi on Thursday asked that the U.S. military in Japan stay inside its bases to prevent the further spread of COVID-19.

TITLE: Unidentified person paid ransom to free three kidnapped Haiti missionaries, workers say
SUMMARY: An unidentified person paid a ransom that freed three missionaries kidnapped by a gang in Haiti under a deal that was supposed to have freed all 15 remaining captives, ministry workers confirmed.

TITLE: Iran wrestling chief, US Green Card holder, calls for a violent  ‘Death to America’
SUMMARY: The president of the Islamic Republic of Iran’s wrestling federation, Alireza Dabir, urged "Death to America" in a television interview on Wednesday, a little over a month before a wrestling dual meet slated to be held between the national teams of the US and Iran in Arlington, Texas on February 12.

TITLE: China: Hospital punished after pregnant woman refused entry has miscarriage
SUMMARY: Hospital officials in the northern Chinese city of Xi’an have been punished after a pregnant woman miscarried after being refused entry, reportedly for not having current COVID-19 test results.

TITLE: 'Leaked' Chinese spy-spoof mocking US draws rare response from MI6 chief: 'free publicity'
SUMMARY: MI6 chief Richard Moore in November labelled China as the UK's top priority, citing the "debt trap" as a mechanism of particular concern.

TITLE: Iran wrestling chief, US green card holder, calls for a violent ‘Death to America’
SUMMARY: The president of the Islamic Republic of Iran’s wrestling federation, Alireza Dabir, urged "Death to America" in a television interview on Wednesday, a little over a month before a wrestling dual meet slated to be held between the national teams of the US and Iran in Arlington, Texas on February 12.

TITLE: Kazakh leader ordered use of lethal force on ‘terrorists’
SUMMARY: The President of Kazakhstan said Friday he authorized law enforcement to open fire on “terrorists” and shoot to kill, a move that comes after days of extremely violent protests in the former Soviet nation.

TITLE: Australian state's COVID-19 rules ban dancing, singing in nightclubs, suspend elective surgeries
SUMMARY: Australia’s most populous state reinstated some restrictions and suspended elective surgeries on Friday as COVID-19 cases surged to another record.

TITLE: China, Russia, North Korea reportedly have successful hypersonic missile tests on heels of America's failure
SUMMARY: China and Russia reportedly completed weapons tests over the summer 2021, with China's glide vehicle capabilities taking US military officials by surprise.

TITLE: As omicron spreads, Europe scrambles to shore up health care
SUMMARY: Nations across Europe are scrambling to prop up health systems strained by staff shortages blamed on the new, highly transmissible omicron variant of the coronavirus, which is sending a wave of infections crashing over the continent.

TITLE: COVID-19: Germany to tighten restaurant rules while cutting quarantine time
SUMMARY: Germany’s leaders agreed Friday to toughen requirements for entry to restaurants and bars, and decided to shorten quarantine and self-isolation periods as the omicron variant spreads fast through the country.

TITLE: NATO foreign ministers discuss Russia's buildup around Ukraine
SUMMARY: NATO foreign ministers on Friday discussed Russia’s military buildup around Ukraine amid skepticism about the credibility of President Vladimir Putin’s offer to ease tensions, ahead of a week of high-level diplomacy aimed at ending the standoff.

TITLE: Orthodox Christians observe Christmas amid COVID concerns
SUMMARY: Orthodox Christians in Russia, Serbia and other countries observed Christmas on Friday amid restrictions aimed at dampening the spread of the coronavirus, but few worshipers appeared concerned as they streamed into churches on Christmas Eve.

TITLE: Anti-regime activists in Iran take credit for torching of Soleimani statue
SUMMARY: Activists opposed to the Iranian regime celebrating the torching of a statue of former Quds leader Qassem Soleimani, who was taken out in a U.S. strike two years ago, with activists claiming it showed their increased ability to fire back at the regime.

TITLE: Macron maintains rude remarks about France's unvaccinated
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday defended his rude remarks about the country's minority of vaccine refusers

TITLE: North Korea claims Kim Jong Il invented the burrito
SUMMARY: Halfway around the world from Mexico, North Korea is now claiming the burrito was invented by Kim Jong Un’s late father, according to reports.

TITLE: Iran Revolutionary Guards commander says 'revenge' coming for Soleimani strike from 'within' US
SUMMARY: Lt. General Qassem Soleimani was killed in a US air strike on Baghdad days after Iranian-backed militia stormed the US embassy in Iraq.

TITLE: NATO says it will not appease Russia with 'second class' allies as meeting looms
SUMMARY: NATO’s secretary general rejected any option to establish "second-class" alliances ahead of the meeting with Russia next week as the Kremlin continues its military aggression along the Ukrainian border.

TITLE: Brazil rock formation collapse kills at least 2, injures 15, caught on video
SUMMARY: At least two people are dead and several injured after a massive rock formation collapsed on top of three boats in Brazil in an incident that was captured on video and posted on social media.

TITLE: Former Kazakhstan anti-terror chief arrested over protests
SUMMARY: The former head of Kazakhstan’s counterintelligence and anti-terror agency has been arrested on charges of attempted government overthrow in the wake of violent protests that the president has blamed on foreign-backed terrorists.

TITLE: Brazil rock formation collapse kills at least 6, injures at least 32; caught on video
SUMMARY: At least six people were killed and dozens injured after a massive rock formation collapsed on top of three boats in Brazil in an incident that was captured on video and posted on social media.

TITLE: Cold kills 22 stuck in cars in heavy snow at Pakistan resort
SUMMARY: At least 22 people, including 10 children, died in a popular mountain resort town in Pakistan after being stuck in their vehicles overnight during a heavy snowstorm

TITLE: Baby lost in chaos of Afghanistan airlift found, returned to family after long ordeal
SUMMARY: The case highlights the plight of many parents separated from their children during the hasty evacuation effort and withdrawal of U.S. forces from the country after a 20-year war.

TITLE: Iran Revolutionary Guard commander says 'revenge' coming for Soleimani strike from 'within' US
SUMMARY: Lt. Gen. Qassem Soleimani was killed in a U.S. air strike on Baghdad days after Iranian-backed militia stormed the U.S. Embassy in Iraq.
